intro: Silene scouleri var. leptophylla, commonly known as the slenderleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. Its flowers, which are pink to purple in color, bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
